intro: Telipogon dubius, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, pale green to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces a single flower spike with few blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Telipogon dubius is considered a rare and endangered species.
